law.full_text:
CLASS H STANDPIPES.
94.2021.1. Class H standpipes are fire lines equipped with 1½-inch hose outlets and intended for use by trained personnel in fighting fires on helicopter landing pads.
94.2021.2. At least one Class H standpipe outlet shall be located outdoors to serve each helicopter landing facility. Every point shall be covered with a 20-foot stream of water from a nozzle connected to not more than 100 feet of hose.
94.2021.3. Class H standpipe outlets shall be located below the glide path. The glide path shall be based on 1-foot vertical to 8-foot horizontal travel.
94.2021.4. Class H standpipe hose outlets shall be readily accessible to the Fire Department.
94.2021.5. Class H standpipe components, material, identification, protection and installation shall comply with the applicable requirements for standpipe systems.
94.2021.6. Class H standpipes shall be flushed for at least one minute.
94.2021.7. Water Supply.
94.2021.7.1. Class H standpipes shall be designed to automatically provide a flow of at least 100 g.p.m. at 65 psi residual pressure.
94.2021.7.2. The emergency supply for Class H standpipes in buildings over 75 feet in height shall have at least 2500 gallons usable capacity in case of failure of the normal power and water services. A Fire Department inlet connection shall be acceptable as this source, provided it complies with the requirements for the Fire Department connection for automatic sprinklers.
94.2021.7.3. (Amended by Ord. No. 179,326, Eff. 12/10/07, Oper. 1/1/08.) When the maximum working pressure exceeds 175 psi at a Class H standpipe outlet, a pressure regulator shall be installed to reduce the static pressure from the outlet to 175 psi or less.
94.2021.8. A minimum 2-inch bypass shall be made between the City water main and the downstream side of any pump when that connection will provide the minimum required flow and pressure for a Class H standpipe.
94.2021.9. Hoses.
94.2021.9.1. Each Class H standpipe outlet shall have a hose valve, fire hose and nozzle.
94.2021.9.2. Fire hoses shall be listed.
94.2021.9.3. Fire hoses shall be 1½ inches in diameter and not over 100 feet long.
94.2021.9.4. Fire hoses shall be lined.
94.2021.9.5. Hose nozzles shall be listed 1½ inch combination fog and straight stream type and shall be of a design acceptable to the Fire Department.
94.2021.9.6. Fire hoses exposed to the weather shall be protected by hose cabinets.
94.2021.10. Hose Racks, Reels and Cabinets.
94.2021.10.1. Hose racks and reels shall be listed.
94.2021.10.2. Any hose cabinet that can be locked shall have an opening with a pane of single-strength glass at least seven inches high and as wide as the construction of the door will permit.
94.2021.10.3. Hose cabinets that can be locked shall be labeled “CAUTION – FOR FIRE FIGHTING BY TRAINED PERSONNEL ONLY” in contrasting letters at least three inches high.
94.2021.11. Outlets shall not be under control of fire sprinkler floor control valves.

unit.catch_line: Liquified Petroleum Gas Facilities And Piping.
Seismic Gas And Excess Flow Shut Off Valves.
Material And Devices, All Fire Protection Systems.

law.plain_text:
LOS ANGELES MUNICIPAL CODE
CLASS H STANDPIPES. (§ 94.2021.0)
CLASS H STANDPIPES.94.2021.1. Class H standpipes are fire lines equipped with 1½-inch hose outlets and intended for use by trained personnel in fighting fires on helicopter landing pads.94.2021.2. At least one Class H standpipe outlet shall be located outdoors to serve each helicopter landing facility. Every point shall be covered with a 20-foot stream of water from a nozzle connected to not more than 100 feet of hose.94.2021.3. Class H standpipe outlets shall be located below the glide path. The glide path shall be based on 1-foot vertical to 8-foot horizontal travel.94.2021.4. Class H standpipe hose outlets shall be readily accessible to the Fire Department.94.2021.5. Class H standpipe components, material, identification, protection and installation shall comply with the applicable requirements for standpipe systems.94.2021.6. Class H standpipes shall be flushed for at least one minute.94.2021.7. Water Supply.94.2021.7.1. Class H standpipes shall be designed to automatically provide a flow of at least 100 g.p.m. at 65 psi residual pressure.94.2021.7.2. The emergency supply for Class H standpipes in buildings over 75 feet in height shall have at least 2500 gallons usable capacity in case of failure of the normal power and water services. A Fire Department inlet connection shall be acceptable as this source, provided it complies with the requirements for the Fire Department connection for automatic sprinklers.94.2021.7.3. (Amended by Ord. No. 179,326, Eff. 12/10/07, Oper. 1/1/08.) When the maximum working pressure exceeds 175 psi at a Class H standpipe outlet, a pressure regulator shall be installed to reduce the static pressure from the outlet to 175 psi or less.94.2021.8. A minimum 2-inch bypass shall be made between the City water main and the downstream side of any pump when that connection will provide the minimum required flow and pressure for a Class H standpipe.94.2021.9. Hoses.94.2021.9.1. Each Class H standpipe outlet shall have a hose valve, fire hose and nozzle.94.2021.9.2. Fire hoses shall be listed.94.2021.9.3. Fire hoses shall be 1½ inches in diameter and not over 100 feet long.94.2021.9.4. Fire hoses shall be lined.94.2021.9.5. Hose nozzles shall be listed 1½ inch combination fog and straight stream type and shall be of a design acceptable to the Fire Department.94.2021.9.6. Fire hoses exposed to the weather shall be protected by hose cabinets.94.2021.10. Hose Racks, Reels and Cabinets.94.2021.10.1. Hose racks and reels shall be listed.94.2021.10.2. Any hose cabinet that can be locked shall have an opening with a pane of single-strength glass at least seven inches high and as wide as the construction of the door will permit.94.2021.10.3. Hose cabinets that can be locked shall be labeled “CAUTION – FOR FIRE FIGHTING BY TRAINED PERSONNEL ONLY” in contrasting letters at least three inches high.94.2021.11. Outlets shall not be under control of fire sprinkler floor control valves.
law.html:
CLASS H STANDPIPES.

94.2021.1.  Class H standpipes are fire lines equipped with 1½-inch hose outlets and intended for use by trained personnel in fighting fires on helicopter landing pads.

94.2021.2.  At least one Class H standpipe outlet shall be located outdoors to serve each helicopter landing facility.  Every point shall be covered with a 20-foot stream of water from a nozzle connected to not more than 100 feet of hose.

94.2021.3.  Class H standpipe outlets shall be located below the glide path.  The glide path shall be based on 1-foot vertical to 8-foot horizontal travel.

94.2021.4.  Class H standpipe hose outlets shall be readily accessible to the Fire Department.

94.2021.5.  Class H standpipe components, material, identification, protection and installation shall comply with the applicable requirements for standpipe systems.

94.2021.6.  Class H standpipes shall be flushed for at least one minute.

94.2021.7.  Water Supply.

94.2021.7.1.  Class H standpipes shall be designed to automatically provide a flow of at least 100 g.p.m. at 65 psi residual pressure.

94.2021.7.2.  The emergency supply for Class H standpipes in buildings over 75 feet in height shall have at least 2500 gallons usable capacity in case of failure of the normal power and water services.  A Fire Department inlet connection shall be acceptable as this source, provided it complies with the requirements for the Fire Department connection for automatic sprinklers.

94.2021.7.3.  (Amended by Ord. No. 179,326, Eff. 12/10/07, Oper. 1/1/08.)  When the maximum working pressure exceeds 175 psi at a Class H standpipe outlet, a pressure regulator shall be installed to reduce the static pressure from the outlet to 175 psi or less.

94.2021.8.  A minimum 2-inch bypass shall be made between the City water main and the downstream side of any pump when that connection will provide the minimum required flow and pressure for a Class H standpipe.

94.2021.9.  Hoses.

94.2021.9.1.  Each Class H standpipe outlet shall have a hose valve, fire hose and nozzle.

94.2021.9.2.  Fire hoses shall be listed.

94.2021.9.3.  Fire hoses shall be 1½ inches in diameter and not over 100 feet long.

94.2021.9.4.  Fire hoses shall be lined.

94.2021.9.5.  Hose nozzles shall be listed 1½ inch combination fog and straight stream type and shall be of a design acceptable to the Fire Department.

94.2021.9.6.  Fire hoses exposed to the weather shall be protected by hose cabinets.

94.2021.10.  Hose Racks, Reels and Cabinets.

94.2021.10.1.  Hose racks and reels shall be listed.

94.2021.10.2.  Any hose cabinet that can be locked shall have an opening with a pane of single-strength glass at least seven inches high and as wide as the construction of the door will permit.

94.2021.10.3.  Hose cabinets that can be locked shall be labeled “CAUTION – FOR FIRE FIGHTING BY TRAINED PERSONNEL ONLY” in contrasting letters at least three inches high.

94.2021.11.  Outlets shall not be under control of fire sprinkler floor control valves.
